spanishExample: Realizaré un estudio sobre el desarrollo social.
englishTranslation: I will carry out a study about social development.
vocabIncluded: realizaré: I will carry out (Realizar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Aquí se realizan muchas actividades importantes.
englishTranslation: Here many important activities are carried out.
vocabIncluded: realizan: they carry out (Realizar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Esto permitirá una mejor relación entre el gobierno y la sociedad.
englishTranslation: This will allow a better relationship between government and society.
vocabIncluded: permitirá: he/she/it will allow (Permitir, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Siempre explicas muy bien las políticas públicas.
englishTranslation: You always explain public policies very well.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things

spanishExample: El partido político creará una nueva ley para el desarrollo social.
englishTranslation: The political party will create a new law for social development.
vocabIncluded: creará: he/she/it will create (Crear, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Esto nos permite entender la relación entre las políticas y los resultados.
englishTranslation: This allows us to understand the relationship between policies and results.

spanishExample: Marta me explicó que su relación con Pedro es un poco extraña.
englishTranslation: Marta explained to me that her relationship with Pedro is a little strange.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Hemos presentado un proyecto para hacer una investigación.
englishTranslation: We have presented a project to do research.
vocabIncluded: hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Aquí no se permite entrar con perros.
englishTranslation: Here, entering with dogs is not allowed.

spanishExample: Aquel día me explicaste que la investigación había sido difícil.
englishTranslation: That day you explained to me that the research had been difficult.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: El equipo nacional presentó una idea muy interesante.
englishTranslation: The national team presented a very interesting idea.

spanishExample: Juan realizará algunos trabajos en una empresa internacional.
englishTranslation: Juan will carry out some work in an international company.
vocabIncluded: realizará: he/she/it will carry out (Realizar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tú realizas investigaciones sobre el sector económico.
englishTranslation: You do investigations about the economic sector.
vocabIncluded: realizas: you carry out (Realizar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: El libro explica muchas cosas de la obra de Pablo Picasso.
englishTranslation: The book explains many things about Pablo Picasso's work.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"

spanishExample: Ella presentará sus fotos en la empresa nacional.
englishTranslation: She will present her photos at the National company.
vocabIncluded: presentará: he/she/it will present (Presentar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Este sistema permitirá que los niños aprendan más rápido y mejor.
englishTranslation: This system will allow children to learn faster and better.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
permitirá: he/she/it will allow (Permitir, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Creaste un sitio en línea para hablar de política?
englishTranslation: Did you create an online site to talk about politics?
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Se crearon muchas obras especiales para el nuevo estudio.
englishTranslation: Many special works were created for the new studio.
vocabIncluded: crearon: they created (Crear, preterite, 3rd person plural)
